intro: Acnida tuberculata var. subnuda, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed acnida, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and are clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
